Articles.Content: 1258: You see that this floor is just that, a floor and nothing else. You teleport up.

1259: You climb up one of those weird stairwells with steps on the top, and upon reaching the midle step, find yourslef on the ceiling. Confused, you walk back up (down?) the stairs to where you came from, and find yourself on floor 1260.
1260: Gravity happens.
1261: you go past another floor on the way to floor 1337
1262: You go past an empty floor.
1263: You go past an even emptier floor.
Floor 1264: This floor has chairs on the ceiling.
Floor 1265: This floor is bleak and boring.
Floor 1266: Temmie Village. hOI!
Floor 1267: You find the information center for the "Really Really Really Tall Building" [SIZE=1]tm[/SIZE]
Floor 1268: lots of trains!
Floor 1269: Still not at the top.
Floot 1270: this floor contains a infinite number of monkeys that want to talk to you about the script for Hamlet they just worked out.
Floor 1271: Full of Bradbury's "Firemen" that want to burn the aforementioned script for Hamlet
Floor 1272: There's a creepy face staring right at you. Then it turns silly.
Floor 1273: Janitor's closet.

Floor 1274: A completely empty floor 3 miles long and half a mile wide, the rest of the stairs are on the other side. However you do not know that the floor is 3 miles long and half a mile wide because there are no lights or windows therefore making it pitch black. So you keep walking wondering why on kerbin you entered the building...
Floor 1275: It's larger than Earth in here! And nobody is here...
1276: Filled with worst fears of visitors. Everything is an illusion, however.
Floor 1277: Contains a giant foot, thousands of times your size, the leg of which seems to extend through the ceiling and into the next floor.
Floor 1278: The leg ends in a smooth, flat circle on the floor, which contains a giant, working compass. The compass needle is slowly rotating.

Floor 1279: The compass needle takes you to the other side.

It's been 3 months.
Floor 1280. You see a magical Rocket....Then you See it is actually a chicken fused kerbal.
1281: A kitchen to cook such animal. Comes standard with solid fuel as cooking fuel.
1282: A diagram of the building. Several hundred floors below you are labeled "UNEXPLORED." Above this is a note: "Estimated Height: 4394582[SIZE=1]E[SIZE=2]98 floors"[/SIZE][/SIZE]
